website_summaries.verdict: This elephant-themed toothbrush makes brushing fun. An inexpensive training toothbrush for baby.
pros: Owners have used it successfully with babies, toddlers, and also dogs
cons: Occasional complaints of bristles falling out

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed 👎
customer_reviews.text: The first time my daughter used the toothbrush I had to throw away, I was worried that she might swallow a piece.
customer_reviews.author: P. Colocolo

customer_reviews.title: Great First Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Great first toothbrush! Dental hygienist here! I did my research and bought about 10 different toothbrushes for my newly toothed infant. I found this one to be my favorite for the shape, size, and softness of the bristles. The design with the “handles” is great to get my little guy interested and involved in his home care routine. I also LOVE that it stands on its own. The toothpaste was useless IMO—personal preference was to start with a fluoridated toothpaste based off of ADA recommendations. It was worth it for the package just to try the brush, however.
customer_reviews.author: Allison S.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: It's great for babies AND small-medium sized dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I love that this brush actually clean my dog's teeth. That's right, I'm using this toothbrush for my dog 😎 The regular toothbrush bristles for dogs are so rough, so I got this one for human baby instead. Couldn't be more pleased with the results. His teeth stays pearly whites, strong and good. I brush his teeth once a day. His breath never smell this good, which means there's no smell, even after he ate many things and woke up to give humans wet kisses.
customer_reviews.author: Bella NTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: UNSAFE: BRISTLES FALL OUT
customer_reviews.text: This brush is soft and cute and fits in baby's hand. BUT the bristles came off in her mouth the first time we tried to use it. I had to pick them out of her mouth. That does not seem safe to me. I would recommend against purchasing. I'd post pics of the bristles, but I've already thrown them away. Will have to find another option.
customer_reviews.author: Askim624

customer_reviews.title: For my 7 month old
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month son just sprouted his 2 bottom teeth about 1 week ago and he's very aware of them and still heavily teething. I figured this was the perfect time to get his 1st toothbrush and toothpaste. Problem is, he's so picky with flavors and textures (gags with anything new and anything sweet). But he loves the flavor of the toothpaste. And like most babies, I thought he would clamp down on the brush. But he enjoyed the feel of the bristles on his new teeth and gums and kept his mouth open so I could brush. So far, Im a very happy momma!
customer_reviews.author: NakWhite

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, ok execution.
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea, but the bristles began to fall out the second our baby chewed on it - which is all they know how to do at first. I did like how the brush head stays off surfaces when sat down.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Frohm

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I've used several brands of toothbrushes for our little one. This is my favorite. It's easy for him to hold, has very soft bristles, & rinses clean with no issue of mold as I've seen others complain about with other toothbrushes. My only complaint is it does wear out quickly. That isn't an awful thing as you should change toothbrushes often anyways but if you have an independent little one who occasionally chews it'll fray the bristles.
customer_reviews.author: McNicholas

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves this set!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old loves getting her teeth brushed with this set! I don’t know if it’s the taste of the toothpaste, or if she likes the feel of the bristles - but who cares!! She lets me brush her teeth!! I was nervous as a first time parent about taking this step, cause babies either love new things or they hate them, but this worked and on the first try!! Ever since her teeth popped through we’ve been using this. Parents will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: First Name Last Name

customer_reviews.title: Pink tax
customer_reviews.text: I’d like to start Off by -shame on you guys for the “pink tax”! that is why I dropped a star! But ok so this toothbrush is great I’m glad I bought it. My 8 month old doesn’t mind me using it on her sore gums so that’s great. She likes to use it as a teether too so the little handles are great. I recommend this but I also recommend other girl moms to take note of this bogus pink tax. Having a pink toothbrush shouldn’t be more expensive it’s the same thing!
customer_reviews.author: amazonlover

customer_reviews.title: This little toothbrush is both adorable and ergonomically designer
customer_reviews.text: This little toothbrush is both adorable and ergonomically designer. My almost 2-year-old daughter loves to brush her teeth, but sometimes she tends to run off with her toothbrush. This was the recent case, so I had to replace the lost toothbrush. The Dr Brown elephant brush is so stinking cute. I love how the ears become an adorable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Best little kid toothbrush I've found
customer_reviews.text: We've tried a lot of different toothbrushes with our almost 2-year-old, she's hated them all. They're all wide and pretty big for a tiny mouth. Not this one! For a really little kid it's great. She likes looking at the elephant while she's getting her teeth brushed, and the width is approximately half that of her old toothbrushes, making for a much happier kiddo. She's happy to have her teeth brushed now.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Received the wrong color
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush and toothpaste are fine, but mine ended up coming as a pink toothbrush. I don't really care what color my son's toothbrush is, but I do want what I order. I took away one star for that. On the other hand, he loves brushing his teeth with this. Mostly just chewing on it after I brush his two front teeth, but he loves it all the same. Nice and soft for his little gums. And, the toothpaste is quite tasty. He doesn't mind it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alison H

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but my son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few different toothbrushes, and my son seems to line this one best. The pink is a little cheaper so we get that one. He really likes the toothpaste too. He’s 2.5 years, and these seem very easy and comfortable for him to hold. I always brush his teeth for him after he’s done and use sparkle crest with fluoride, but this is a good way for him to get comfortable with it.
customer_reviews.author: Linnea B.

customer_reviews.title: Bristles come out during first few uses
customer_reviews.text: My 20m old son likes to "bosh" his teeth with us, which is great! He likes this tooth brush a lot and uses it every day, although I question his technique. My complaint is that first there were bristles coming out, which is no good. Now all the loose ones are gone but the remaining bristles look pretty beat up. He's had it for maybe 2 months. So not super well made or durable.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I really like the brush on this set
customer_reviews.text: I really like the brush on this set, it holds up pretty well to my toddler's brushing/biting. The bristles are soft and does not come off. Also, the color and the design with the elephant ears are adorable. However, I was not a bog fan of the toothpaste. My toddler does not mind the flavor (pear and apple) but I dont feel its doing much to clean his teeth. After my son's first dental visit, he got a Crest kids in his free goodie bag from the dentists and that works so much better to clean his teeth and freshen his breath.
customer_reviews.author: Andy S.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for babies and toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for little baby teeth. My 14 month old almost all his teeth out. He got them really early, 4 at 12 weeks and has almost all his molars in now so brushing his teeth was a big deal here. I’ve tried many other toothbrushes and this one was perfect. Small enough for use for a 4 month old but not so small that a toddler can’t use it. Really soft and easy to grip. He can easily *attempt* to brush his teeth himself.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: They love brushing their teeth which may have something to do ...
customer_reviews.text: I think these toothbrush are cute especially when I realized that it's an elephant! I ended up getting a blue version somewhere else because of cost but got the pink one here since I have boy/girl twins. They love brushing their teeth which may have something to do with the tooth paste. I hope it's good for them. Unfortunately, the bristles do get messed up since little ones will bite at it and so I've seen bristles being pulled out but now all the way. I've had to cut it down so the loose ones wouldn't poke them.
customer_reviews.author: Greyson.n.Adelyn

customer_reviews.title: Bristles started falling off
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this toothbrush for my oldest as a training toothbrush when he was 6 months old. he loved it, we had no problem. I just bought it again for my second baby. We’ve been using it for a week, but bristles already started falling off. I threw it away immediately. Not sure if we got the defected one, or all the same.
customer_reviews.author: Alta

customer_reviews.title: Great brush, doesn't stand up well
customer_reviews.text: We love this little brush for our 1 year old! Easy to hold and soft. My only complaint - though minor- is that it falls over every time I stand it up, and falls out of the medicine cabinet every time I open it. I prefer the brushes with sticky-rubber bottoms for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Caveman

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toothbrush for my 15months old daughter. She has been using for like 2 weeks and the brush was tearing off and looked in a bad shape. Bad quality. Never buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Rance

customer_reviews.title: Bristles coming off
customer_reviews.text: I read a review that the bristles were falling, but I still took my chances and yes! After a week or two it started falling one by one. I saw 6 pieces already. My 17 month old has 3 teeth upper and 2 teeth lower. I dont want my baby to choke with bristles. Buy at your own risk!
customer_reviews.author: CJ Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Super cute!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little training toothbrush. I bought it for my 10 month old and he loves to hold it and practice brushing his teeth with it. It's very easy for him to hold onto. The toothpaste also has a light fruity taste that he seems to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: NA Costa

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush for my little guy!
customer_reviews.text: We're using this as a starter toothbrush for my 8 month old. It's easy for him to grab and small enough to fit easily in his mouth. He loves the toothpaste! So far, so good! I haven't had any bristles come out or anything like that. =)
customer_reviews.author: sarahpaige

customer_reviews.title: It's a great toothbrush but it only last 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: It's a great toothbrush but it only last 2 weeks. For some reason, it is already out of shape after 2 weeks of use, my son doesn't have this problem with other toothbrushs. For the price, I won't buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: My daughter likes it very much
customer_reviews.text: The size of both the brush and the handle is perfect for my 3 year old daughter. She enjoys using it much more than before. We also like the design of it so that it never touch the floor when standing up or lying down. This would help reduce the contamination of it.
customer_reviews.author: Zhuai

customer_reviews.title: Losing bristles after just a few usages.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased one of these previously and thought it worked well for my toddler so I purchased another and am very disappoint. After using for a short time it has begin to lose bristles which is very dangerous for my 19-month old. I am trying to teach my child that brushing is fun and a good thing but after having bristles poking their mouth it is now very difficult to get them to willingly brush.
customer_reviews.author: Sudeep Singh

customer_reviews.title: Very safe (obviously under supervision) and she doesn’t hate the flavor of the toothpaste which is ok to ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. It’s her first toothbrush which I bought to get her familiarized with the habit of brushing and for her to practice doing it on her own. I just put a little dab of toothpaste and give it to her and she “brushes” all by herself. Her technique still needs work but she feels so proud that she can be a big girl and do it herself. Very safe (obviously under supervision) and she doesn’t hate the flavor of the toothpaste which is ok to swallow, especially such a small amount.
customer_reviews.author: Dayana

customer_reviews.title: Our toddler loves it, and so do we!
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler loves this toothbrush. It is the second kind we have tried, and she loves brushing her teeth. The other reviews are true though, sometimes bristles come out, which I don't think is great if swallowed. My favorite part is that when it is set down, bristles facing down, the bristles do not touch the surface. We have purchased this toothbrush twice now, and plan to purchase again in another month. She likes to chew the bristles, so they tend to get flat after a month. We swapped her last one out after three months.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Marquette

customer_reviews.title: The tooth brush became my sons lovey
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month loves it..... it actually became his lovey! So funny, I gave him stuffed animals and teething toys hoping he chose one as lovey, but he didn’t like any of them, finally fell in love with this toothbrush...... we bring it everywhere and he brushes his 4 teeth all day long hahahhaha
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: Baby girl loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my little girl and she loves it! It’s soft and easy to grip in my hand or her own hand. Whenever she sees it she goes crazy because she wants to brush her teeth! I will continue to buy this for her until she’s a toddler
customer_reviews.author: Gaby Garcia-Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Ok so the toothbrush gets 5 stars. GENIUS idea ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok so the toothbrush gets 5 stars. GENIUS idea to put the little wings on a toothbrush for safety purposes. The toothpaste is the reason for 4 stars. I’d say that gets 3 stars. My son’s breath still stinks after brushing with this. I normally use Toms (and people my son is 18 months old so I don’t rwally have many options with toothpaste) anyway, we could just brush his teeth with dr browns and he still has gross breath the second we are done.
customer_reviews.author: TJ's WifeTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great baby toothbrush, son likes it :)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toothbrush for babies. I’ve been having issues getting my son to take a toothbrush but this one he does not mind and even “practices” himself. Toothpaste doesn’t seem to bother him at all and he can be pretty particular with tastes.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good starter brush
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old is now on her second one. She loves the pink color and the elephant theme best out of all her toothbrushes (we bought a lot of them in the process of trying to get her interested when she was younger so she has quite a collection).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft bristles, great tasting natural toothpaste.
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush is adorable, easy to fat toddler hands to hold, and the bristles are very soft. Our child LOVES the taste of the toothpaste, and I think she thinks of it as "dessert" since we brush her teeth after dinner. She will try to suck all the paste off first before she lets us get to her molars. My only complaint is that the bristles have worn down and jut to the sides after just two months.
customer_reviews.author: slashfemme

customer_reviews.title: Perfect combo
customer_reviews.text: This is similar to the one my two year old had that was also a teether but it tore to pieces as it wasn’t a real toothbrush but silicone. This comes with the toothpaste as well so this will be perfect when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Israel

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute toothbrush. I like that you can place it standing and the elephant design is also adorable. My toddler loved looking at the elephant before the brush went into her mouth. But the product simply didn't last very long. By the third week, the bristles were all over the place. Granted, toddlers like to bite their toothbrushes, but I am using one currently that is lasting much longer. I just don't think I would go back to using this one.
customer_reviews.author: Esther H. Song

customer_reviews.title: Good product-will continue to order
customer_reviews.text: We really like these tooth brushes and will continue to use them, but just wish they were a bit cheaper because the bristles do not last as long as I would like. Seems like you have to replace them quite frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Suzears

customer_reviews.title: Good design but wears down quickly
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old daughter loves using this toothbrush but with regular use (morning and night) the bristles wear down so quickly that I've had to buy several toothbrushes over just a few months. Moving on to another brand with hopes of finding something better.
customer_reviews.author: JayAR

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter and we used it in the morning when she takes a shower and at night when she takes another shower. She loves the toothpaste and the toothbrush is really good too, very soft with her teeth. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Fun Brushing Time
customer_reviews.text: My 15 mo old loves this toothbrush. We were having a hard time brushing so I went 1st-time-mom-crazy and pretty much bought every toothbrush with a decent rating. Hahaha, now it took some time and some creative singing but in the end this little guy won the fight and now brushing isn't such a pain. Thanks for a great product whoever thought of this!
customer_reviews.author: Leaf Eater

customer_reviews.title: Baby’s first toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This is my sons first toothbrush. The bristles seems to come apart from the toothbrush easily. He likes the taste of the toothpaste but not sure how good it was at actually cleaning his teeth.
customer_reviews.author: VuuFam

customer_reviews.title: Soft Brush head, easy to use for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has recently became obsessed with brushing her teeth (all 6 of them..) so shes been going through them fairly frequently. the brush head is very soft, and the handle appears to be a good anti-choke mechanism if your child has an issue with shoving things in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love this toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Love this toothbrush! I was pretty surprised that my 11 mo old loved the toothpaste and therefore was very willing to let her tooth be brushed. The toothbrush stands up well and can also rest on it’s side without touching the surface. The design is super cute and it’s a perfect little size for baby’s mouth. I liked this better than the banana silicon brush teether.
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Baby likes it
customer_reviews.text: Started using this when baby was 11 months old. Her first toothbrush and toothpaste. She really likes it. Whenever she seems it, she smiles and opens her mouth. I think she likes the taste because she tries to eat the toothbrush but will eventually let me brush her teeth. Been using it for two months now.
customer_reviews.author: Nime

customer_reviews.title: Okay for beginners but not for the long run.
customer_reviews.text: We were happy with this for a few months until I notices that it started getting moldy. I always clean the brush and dry it but the way its made makes it hard to dry well. Also the little hairs start sticking out after a while. It is a good tooth brush for beginning but not for the long run. I ended up purchasing other brand and they are great. I still use this toothpaste, seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item and would happily recommend it to others. We have not had any challenges using it and found it to be a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Here

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: my kids began to brush his teeth, and eat the paste very time that we can not stop. This means he like the flavor of the teeth paste. LOL. It is good the use, the size is also suitable.
customer_reviews.author: yingying8825

customer_reviews.title: Good but bristles a little cheap.
customer_reviews.text: The brush has a very nice grip however the bristles come out very loosely. Bristles could be softer, toothpaste was fine my baby enjoyed brushing their teeth. Just would advise having softer bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied baby, happy Mommy
customer_reviews.text: My baby looks forward to brushing her teeth. As soon as she's done eating, she signs wash hands and brush teeth. She's got her routine down. I'm absolutely satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ceci

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 mo grandson loves it; it is fun and easy to use! He likes to hold it and he likes the flavor of the toothpaste. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Balburam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t clean very well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my baby’s first toothbrush, and now that shes making it easier to brush them, I can see that her teeth are all stained and gross. I brush 2-3 times a day, so either the brush or the toothpaste suck. I’m going to have to get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ebner

customer_reviews.title: Baby perfect
customer_reviews.text: Our almost 1 yr old little guy loves his toothbrush and toothpaste! He loves the taste and it fits perfectly in his hand.
customer_reviews.author: NurseMommy

customer_reviews.title: need more soft
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush is lovely, but I personally think a little hard, children should use a softer toothbrush better
customer_reviews.author: Fangyi Li

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My baby, (15 months), uses this toothbrush as a tether. It’s her favorite toy right now and she never puts it down.
customer_reviews.author: Spyke

customer_reviews.title: Super kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: Love the ears! They not only make it so the toothbrush can rest on the counter without touching it but also makes it slip free and choke free for my 1 year old!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 18 month old son. The brush is adorable and fits well in my son’s mouth. He enjoys having his teeth brush, and it seems to be very gentle. Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra J.

customer_reviews.title: Its a pink elephant
customer_reviews.text: Its a super cute toothbrush. I hate tacky looking stuff and I wasnt about to get my daughter a My Little Pony toothbrush until she is able to actually ask for one. So I settled on this super cute toothbrush. It is definitely easy to hold with the little elephant ears.
customer_reviews.author: Lexus C.

customer_reviews.title: Good toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the toothbrush. It’s easy for him to hold and fits perfectly into his mouth for brushing. However, I feel like the toothbrush itself is difficult to clean. Seems like the toothpaste collects at the base of the bristles and it’s hard to clean. The toothpaste is not the best but my son doesn’t mind the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Dr Brown brand for my child because I trust this so much but this tooth brush is huge disappointment for me... it's too hard and its falling off.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Cute little tooth brush with tons of baby safe toothpaste. The tooth paste quantity will outlast the brush. Good quality. Was pleased
customer_reviews.author: Terry House

customer_reviews.title: Happy 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old loves the flavor of the paste. I was hesitant because there were mixed reviews, but bristles are intact, and my son thinks it’s fun to brush his teeth, so that’s a win for me.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Pilkington

customer_reviews.title: A nice first toothbrush for baby
customer_reviews.text: I really like the color and design. The baby is getting his teeth in now. I can’t wait to start using it!
customer_reviews.author: Debra kilb

customer_reviews.title: Best baby toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I really like this toothbrush. My baby can hold it, and I like that the elephant ears keep it from going too far into their mouth, as well as supports it in a toothbrush holder so I don't have to lay it on the counter. The bristles are nice and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Stapayr8485

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toothbrush for littles!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality toothbrush for any baby or toddler! Cute design and easy to use and hold. Very pleased with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: our baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our Daughter is always trying to act grown up and she loved this and uses it every time its her bath time.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Mateo

customer_reviews.title: Good toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush is very soft than before my daughter used. She pretty like the toothbrush and everyday go to brush her teeth consciously. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: freyawu

customer_reviews.title: Works for us.
customer_reviews.text: We used to use the little tooth brushes that go on your fingers, but once our baby started chomping down on our poor fingers, we had to find a more traditional kind of toothbrush for her. It's working well so far. She puts it in her mouth and makes brushing motions, but isn't quite skilled enough to use it on her own yet.
customer_reviews.author: bcc

customer_reviews.title: toothbrush and teething toy
customer_reviews.text: my 15mo old loves it! i put him in the exersaucer and let him brush his own teeth for about 5mins a day. he loves chewing all over it too.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Marquez

customer_reviews.title: It's good except for some wild bristles
customer_reviews.text: there are at least 3 bristles wanting to run away. It pokes my baby and she hates the feeling. As a mom though, I think it's a good toothbrush if not for the runaway bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Thea

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and nice color , baby easy to handle, but it’s a little bit difficult for parents hold to help baby brush
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: ... hates getting her teeth brushed but this is the perfect size for her little mouth and hands
customer_reviews.text: My daughter hates getting her teeth brushed but this is the perfect size for her little mouth and hands. I like the "elephant ears" stoppers so that she can't push the toothbrush too far into her mouth as well as propping it on the counter. It's a good sturdy brush with soft bristles. Perfect for a first toothbrush!
customer_reviews.author: thejenspot

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old loves to hold onto her tooth brush and brush her teeth while I brush mine. I obviously do it after, but it’s easy to hold for little and big hands! The bristles are soft and don’t cause any pain. Will definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: AJKJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves getting his teeth brushed with this toothbrush he will go at it himself on his gums as well!
customer_reviews.author: Daysi

customer_reviews.title: for our 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: started to use it. He loves to put anything in his mouth so it was easy to work with
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: 10mo loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy loves this toothbrush and wants to carry it around with him! We have to be careful though because he tries to bite the bristles and they’re already a little frayed after only having this for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: EstradaFam

customer_reviews.title: Great first toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a transitional toothbrush from the banana toothbrush. I loved that it came with its own toothpaste, as I was nervous to use any else. The scent is quite nice and my one year old son took to it immediately. The fins on the handle seemed to make it more appealing to him and the flavor was just an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: My 1-year old loves this combination! At this point she pretty much just swallows the toothpaste but she thinks the apple-pear flavor is great. The bristles are super soft so they don't hurt her gums. It has held up well the past few months considering she "brushes" twice a day and ends up chewing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Soft Brush and Easy to Hold. Doesn't Stand Up on its Own
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this more. It's cute and easy to hold for my toddler but it doesn't stand up on the counter by itself. Leans and falls over most times. If you want to put it in a cup and are ok, then this shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: wcandcj

customer_reviews.title: Stiff brush
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape of the handle but the brush is actually very stiff. Not very impressed...
customer_reviews.author: Yumi

customer_reviews.title: Broke in just 1 use
customer_reviews.text: I love Dr. Brown's products but this brush broke in 1 day
customer_reviews.author: ZaVi25HonestMommy

customer_reviews.title: Kudos to the elephant design!
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most is the elephant design which does not let the bristles touch the floor even when dropped. We had one earlier and I guess the bristles came out rough and crooked in 6 months. Bought another one again recently
customer_reviews.author: Sujith N.

customer_reviews.title: Great kids toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality and price of this toothbrush. It is the perfect size for toddlers and the toothpaste is great quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Kelly

customer_reviews.title: My son likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Pink one was on sale, so we bought it for our 19-month-year-old son :) The brush looks like an elephant, which makes it disctint from other brushes at home. My son prefers it among others. Ears of the elephant causes a little troble while holding the brush, but they provide the brush to stay away from the floor. We like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The brush is the perfect size for small hands and the ears help to ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 1 year old to help her get into the routine of brushing her teeth. The brush is the perfect size for small hands and the ears help to guide her where to grab it. The toothpaste has worked well and she seems to enjoy the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold, only thing I didn't like were some of the bristles were really long and just choppy. I know to just cut them shorter to match the length but I feel they shouldn't even be flawed in the first place
customer_reviews.author: Mckenzy Werth

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad it's non-toxic for a toddler who hasn't quite figured ...
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loves to brush her teeth "by herself" with this brush! She also loves the taste of the toothpaste. I'm glad it's non-toxic for a toddler who hasn't quite figured out how to spit it out well yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Viana

customer_reviews.title: Best toddler brush!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite toothbrush for my toddler! Perfect for little hands! I’ve purchased multiple brushes and this one by far is the easiest for my toddler to handle! The only complaint is I wish they had more color options to make it fun!!
customer_reviews.author: kallen

customer_reviews.title: Very  versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Love these containers. I actually bought them to store my granddaughters food in them. The four compartments make it easy to store a complete meal for her. Now, no need for several little containers in the fridge... just one that holds everything.
customer_reviews.author: VJM

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Perfect size and adorable. My 1 complaint that I wish I would have checked is that there is no suction cup on the end like normally on childrens toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter (15 mos) likes this a lot more than the plasticky toddler toothbrushes -- especially because the handle on this lends itself well to her brushing her teeth by herself (with quick follow up from mom and dad)
customer_reviews.author: pdxmel

customer_reviews.title: good review, playful product
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this I looked around for other toothbrushes. I decided to go with this one for three reasons .... good review, playful product, and toothpaste. My daughter has loved this product since the day I introduced this to her. It's easy for her to hold and fits well in her mouth. She actually points to the toothbrush and asks for it every time we are bathing her. Happy baby = happy parent so yes, definitely a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was my daughter's first toothbrush and continues to be ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my daughter's first toothbrush and continues to be the only toothbrush she wants to use (we've tried others and she politely threw them in my direction) and the toothpaste is very tasty. Yes, I've tasted them.
customer_reviews.author: JoeySmash

customer_reviews.title: Quality made, fun toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old loves this toothbrush. I love that the brush part doesn’t sit directly on the counter. It’s easy for her to hold and move around in her mouth. Pretty good price for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: MikeBri Bohn

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: He thinks it is a shark somehow. Lol. Anyway, works for me as long as he wants to brush his teeth. Nice design for a great price
customer_reviews.author: Yun

customer_reviews.title: Great first toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Great first toothbrush. Started using this when my daughter was 9 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Pitt_Panther12

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: My 21 month old loves brushing her teeth with this. Taste great and easy to hold for little hands.
customer_reviews.author: theshug80

customer_reviews.title: Toddler & parents love it!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler was thrilled to get and start using this toothbrush. The "ears" keep the brush head from touching the counter surface when place down. Perfect size and bristles are not too hard or soft. Toothbrushing time is not a battle, but a fun time with mom or dad.
customer_reviews.author: House of Cats

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Let's be real, I'm using this on an 18 month old, and really, how well am I actually doing in there? But, this seems to be one of the better bushes I've used on him. Bonus that the bottom is flat, so it sits up on its own in the counter.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Our 2 year old can hold it easily and enjoys the toothpaste. Have not noticed any bristle coming out. Soft bristle don’t irritate her gums even when teething
customer_reviews.author: Clawson, MI

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 16 month old! We started with a finger toothbrush but when she started wanting to just play with it, decided it was time for something more real like. She brushes with this so much better and it’s a great transition to the next phase. Small too and fits her hand perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

product_meta.title: Dr. Brown's Infant-to-Toddler Toothbrush,Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BlueBrush your little one's teeth the easy and comfortable way. Help establish good oral hygiene habits that will last a lifetime with Dr. Brown's(TM) Infant-to-Toddler Toothbrush. This training toothbrush is super-soft and safe for baby's first teeth. Flexible body is gentle on sensitive gums and the comfort-grip handle is easy for little hands to hold. Shaped like an elephant to help make tooth-brushing time fun. The Perfect Training Toothbrush Helps to establish good oral hygiene habits that will last a lifetime. Super-Soft and Safe for Baby's First Teeth The perfect-sized toothbrush for your little one's teeth and gums. Flexible Body is Gentle On Sensitive Gums Makes it easier to brush when infants are teething or experiencing gum discomfort. Comfort-Grip Handle is Easy for Little Hands To Hold Helps your child get a comfortable grip during the tooth-brushing process. Instructions for use. Clean toothbrush before and after each use with warm water. Inspect toothbrush before and after each use and discard if worn or damaged. Do not boil, steam or microwave sterilize. Do not put in the dishwasher. Dentists recommend replacing your toothbrush every 3 months. for your child's safety and health WARNING. Tooth brushing should be supervised by an adult. Do not let your young child walk or crawl with the toothbrush in his/her hand or mouth. Dr. Brown's Infant-to-Toddler Toothbrush is part of a complete family of products that grows with your baby, including bottles and bottle accessories, breastfeeding products, pacifiers and teethers, cups and solid feeding innovations, and healthy wipes. At Dr. Brown's, all we do is infant feeding and every day we strive to build on our expertise and heavy focus on research and development to deliver the reliable products that have made us a proven favorite with moms and dads. This means we invest as much time as necessary to create quality products with distinctive health-related benefits that help your little ones feed happy.
feature_bullets: Super-soft and safe for baby's first teeth
Flexible body is gentle on sensitive gums
Comfort-grip handle is easy for little hands to hold
Shaped like an elephant to help make tooth-brushing time fun
